categories.title: Resources
categories.summary: If you or someone you know is experiencing domestic violence, there are resources available to help. Below are tools and information to support you in finding safety and healing.

topics.title: Red Flag Checklist
topics.description: A guide to recognizing warning signs of abusive behavior in relationships.

topics.title: Mental Health Resources
topics.description: Access to counseling, therapy, and hotlines for emotional support and trauma recovery.

topics.title: Understanding Domestic Violence
topics.description: Learn about the different forms of abuse, including physical, emotional, financial, and digital abuse.

topics.title: Financial Assistance Programs
topics.description: Organizations that provide financial support for housing, legal fees, and other needs for survivors.

topics.title: Legal Aid Services
topics.description: Free or low-cost legal help for restraining orders, custody battles, and other legal protections.

categories.title: Know Your Rights
categories.summary: Understanding your legal rights is crucial for protecting yourself and seeking justice. Below are resources to help you navigate your rights as a survivor of domestic violence.

topics.title: Your Rights to Protection
topics.description: Learn about restraining orders, emergency protective orders, and how to file them.

topics.title: Your Rights in the Workplace
topics.description: Understand your rights to safety accommodations, leave, and protection from discrimination.

topics.title: Your Rights as a Tenant
topics.description: Information on breaking a lease, eviction protections, and housing rights for survivors.

topics.title: Your Rights to Confidentiality
topics.description: Know your rights to privacy when seeking medical, legal, or counseling services.

categories.title: Emergency Services
categories.summary: If you are in immediate danger, these resources can help you find safety and support right away.

topics.title: Contact Law Enforcement
topics.description: How to safely contact police and what to expect when reporting domestic violence.

topics.title: Find a Shelter
topics.description: Locate nearby domestic violence shelters and safe houses for emergency housing.

topics.title: Crisis Hotlines
topics.description: 24/7 hotlines for immediate support, including the National Domestic Violence Hotline.

topics.title: Escape Plan Guide
topics.description: Step-by-step instructions on creating a safe plan to leave an abusive situation.

topics.title: Emergency Contacts
topics.description: Save trusted contacts for quick access to help in a crisis.

categories.title: Health and Wellness
categories.summary: Healing from domestic violence is a journey. Below are resources to support your physical, emotional, and mental well-being.

topics.title: Trauma Recovery
topics.description: Resources for healing from the emotional and psychological effects of abuse.

topics.title: Medical Support
topics.description: Find healthcare providers who specialize in treating survivors of domestic violence.

topics.title: Self-Care Strategies
topics.description: Practical tips for managing stress, building resilience, and practicing self-care.

topics.title: Support for Children
topics.description: Resources to help children who have witnessed or experienced domestic violence.

categories.title: Community and Support
categories.summary: You are not alone. Connect with others who understand your experiences and find strength in community.

topics.title: Support Groups
topics.description: Join local or online groups for survivors of domestic violence to share and heal together.

topics.title: Advocacy Organizations
topics.description: Find organizations that fight for the rights of survivors and provide resources.

topics.title: Educational Workshops
topics.description: Attend workshops on topics like safety planning, legal rights, and rebuilding your life.

topics.title: Volunteer Opportunities
topics.description: Ways to give back by supporting other survivors or raising awareness about domestic violence.
